item.title: Celeste add a quote by Jennifer Egan
item.description: "I'm always happy," Sasha said. "Sometimes I just forget." -- Jennifer Egan

item.title: Celeste add a quote by W.B. Yeats
item.description: "The world is full of magic things, patiently waiting for our senses to grow sharper." -- W.B. Yeats

item.title: Celeste add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Quotation is a serviceable substitute for wit." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Celeste add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Celeste add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "If you are going through hell, keep going." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Celeste add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Celeste add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "We cannot live only for ourselves. A thousand fibers connect us with our fellow men; and among those fibers, as sympathetic threads, our actions run as causes, and they come back to us as effects." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Celeste add a quote by George Sand
item.description: "Let us accept truth, even when it surprises us and alters our views." -- George Sand

item.title: Celeste add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Celeste add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Celeste add a quote by Frederick Douglass
item.description: "Once you learn to read, you will be forever free." -- Frederick Douglass

item.title: Celeste add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "When I despair, I remember that all through history the way of truth and love have always won. There have been tyrants and murderers, and for a time, they can seem invincible, but in the end, they always fall. Think of it--always." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Celeste add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Never laugh at live dragons." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Celeste add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Celeste add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Maybe everâ€™body in the whole damn world is scared of each other." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Celeste add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "You may not control all the events that happen to you, but you can decide not to be reduced by them." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Celeste add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "There comes a time when one must take a position that is neither safe, nor politic, nor popular, but he must take it because conscience tells him it is right." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Celeste add a quote by Edward Gorey
item.description: "Books, Cats, Life is Good." -- Edward Gorey

item.title: Celeste add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "After everything that's happened, how can the world still be so beautiful? Because it is." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Celeste add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Celeste add a quote by Patricia Highsmith
item.description: "Anticipation! It occurred to him that his anticipation was more pleasant to him than the experiencing." -- Patricia Highsmith

item.title: Celeste add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Celeste add a quote by Conan O'Brien
item.description: "If you work really hard, and you're kind, amazing things will happen." -- Conan O'Brien

item.title: Celeste add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Celeste add a quote by L. Frank Baum
item.description: "No thief, however skillful, can rob one of knowledge, and that is why knowledge is the best and safest treasure to acquire." -- L. Frank Baum

item.title: Celeste add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "The thing that is really hard, and really amazing, is giving up on being perfect and beginning the work of becoming yourself." -- Anna Quindlen
